title: Converts `lfe::felm()` To The `fixest::feols()` Equivalents
text: goal lfe2fixest take R scripts rely felm() function lfe package convert feols() equivalents fixest package. want ? lfe::felm() fixest::feols() provide “fixed-effects” estimation routines high-dimensional data. methods also highly optimised. However, feols() newer, tends significantly faster, allows lot functionality (e.g. predict method). time, primary author lfe stopped developing package. since adopted, now essentially pure maintenance mode. syntax felm() feols() similar, albeit one necessarily providing drop-replacement . example, following two lines code functionally equivalent versions underlying model.1 felm(y ~ x1 + x2 | fe1 + fe2 | (x3 | x4 ~ z1 + z2) | cl1, data = dat) feols(y ~ x1 + x2 | fe1 + fe2 | c(x3, x4) ~ z1 + z2, cluster = ~cl1, data = dat) lfe2fixest package automates translation kinds models. best ignoring non-relevant arguments adjust differing syntax options felm() feols(). end goal converted R script produce exactly output, minor caveats notwithstanding.

title: Converts `lfe::felm()` To The `fixest::feols()` Equivalents

title: Converts `lfe::felm()` To The `fixest::feols()` Equivalents
text: ’m confident lfe2fixest work ---box (9 10?) situations, minor caveats bear mind. feols() offers variety optimised features syntax things like varying slopes, multiple estimation, etc. go beyond standard R syntax (although latter still works). lfe2fixest doesn’t try exploit specialised features. ’s less literal translation felm() formula. goal get running little pain possible, rather eking every extra bit feols()’s already eye-watering performance. Similarly, felm() feols() share arguments, cases conversion can yield different results. example case multiway clustering felm() call specify right cmethod option. (.) conversion handles (attempts handle) actual model calls. attempt made convert downstream objects functions like regression table construction. Although, demonstrated example, okay use modern table-generating package like modelsummary. true stargazer, example. assume users always provide dataset model calls (.e.  regressions global variables supported). Similarly, package supports models explicitly written script. models constructed programatically (e.g. Formula()) conversion probably won’t work. 1 IV regression multiple endogenous variables fixed effects, well clustered standard errors. ’s besides point.↩︎

what: Converts lfe::felm() commands into their fixest::feols() equivalents. — lfe2fixest
title: Converts lfe::felm() commands into their fixest::feols() equivalents. — lfe2fixest
text: Takes R script lfe::felm() commands, converts fixest::feols equivalents, exports resulting script disk. Conversion thing . Neither input output script run.

title: Converts lfe::felm() commands into their fixest::feols() equivalents. — lfe2fixest
code: lfe2fixest(infile = NULL, outfile = NULL, verbose = FALSE, robust = FALSE)  felm2feols(infile = NULL, outfile = NULL, verbose = FALSE, robust = FALSE)

title: Converts lfe::felm() commands into their fixest::feols() equivalents. — lfe2fixest
text: infile R script containing lfe::felm() commands. Required. outfile File connection write resulting R script (.e. fixest::feols() conversion) . Can input script, case latter obviously overwritten. Can also left blank case nothing written disk output simply printed screen. verbose Logical. result printed screen. Defaults FALSE unless outfile left blank. robust Logical. default, iid errors used unless cluster variables specified felm() formula(s). users like HC-robust standard errors, specify TRUE. ignored felm formula contains cluster variables, since errors default cluster-robust.

title: Converts lfe::felm() commands into their fixest::feols() equivalents. — lfe2fixest
Converts lfe::felm() commands into their fixest::feols() equivalents. — lfe2fixest
text: lfe::felm() fixest::feols() provide "fixed-effects" estimation routines high-dimensional data. methods highly optimised, although feols() newer tends quite bit faster. syntax two methods similar, quite offering drop-replacement. function aims automate conversion process; ignoring non-relevant arguments differing options two, best ensure resulting scripts produce output. Note conversion handles (attempts handle) actual model calls. attempt made convert downstream objects functions like regression table construction. Although, probably okay use modern table-generating package like modelsummary. limitations include: (1) function less implements literal translation relevant felm model. support translation specialised syntax feols() offers, e.g. multiple estimation varying slopes. Everything still work even literal translation yield additional performance boosts tricks feols() offers. (2) function assumes users always provide dataset model calls; .e. regressions global variables supported. (3) Similarly, models constructed programatically (e.g. Formula()) supported.

title: Converts lfe::felm() commands into their fixest::feols() equivalents. — lfe2fixest
code: if (FALSE) { ## Write a (deliberately messy) lfe script lfe_string = " library(lfe) library(modelsummary)  ## Our toy dataset aq = airquality names(aq) = c('y', 'x1', 'x2', 'x3', 'mnth', 'dy')  ## Simple OLS (no FEs) mod1 = felm(y ~ x1 + x2, aq)  ## Add a FE and cluster variable mod2 = felm(y ~ x1 + x2 |               dy |               0 |               mnth, aq)  ## Add a second cluster variable and some estimation options mod3 = felm(y ~ x1 + x2 |               dy |               0 |               dy + mnth,             cmethod = 'reghdfe',             exactDOF = TRUE,             aq)  ## IV reg with weights mod4 = felm(y ~ 1 |               dy |               (x1 ~ x3) |               mnth,             weights = aq$x2,             data = aq             )  ## Regression table mods = list(mod1, mod2, mod3, mod4) msummary(mods, gof_omit = 'Pseudo|Within|Log|IC', output = 'markdown') " writeLines(lfe_string, 'lfe_script.R')  ## Covert to fixest equivalents lfe2fixest('lfe_script.R') ## no output file provided, will print to screen lfe2fixest('lfe_script.R', 'fixest_script.R') ## write converted script to disk  ## Check equivalence  ## First the lfe version source('lfe_script.R', print.eval = TRUE)  ## Then the fixest conversion source('fixest_script.R', print.eval = TRUE)  ## Clean up file.remove(c('lfe_script.R', 'fixest_script.R')) } if (FALSE) { ## For people that like options, there's the felm2feols() alias... felm2fixest('another_felm_script.R') }
